name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: The general public in China generally believes that the White Paper Movement and college students had the greatest impact on the policy shift, but in fact, during that week, Foxconn workers had the most intense conflict. Urumqi citizens rushed into the division headquarters. On the evening of the 27th, tens of thousands of people took to Hanzheng Street in Wuhan, which was the largest scale and the city with the most public facilities destroyed that night. What they have in common is that they did not hold up white papers or call for resignation, but demanded the lifting of the blockade.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: In fact, the two demands are carried out in parallel. The white paper and slogans of first-tier cities are eye-catching and eye-catching, covering up the core problem faced by the grassroots people, that is, the so-called "normal life" of netizens has always been achieved by sacrificing the lives of the grassroots people. They have no voice channels, and no one cares about their lives. This is destined to make them perish in silence and explode in silence at the same time.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
Compared to the moderation of citizens and students in the White Paper Movement, grassroots people expressed their demands with practical actions.
Which way of expressing demands is more decisive for policy shifts? I think everyone has their own answer.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content:
In the past three years, netizens have rarely cared about those who have been quarantined for themselves.
Regarding this kind of thing, we always hear "If it weren't like this, more people would be infected."
However, in reality, for the lower-class people, there is no income, no assistance, no subsidies, and even no thanks.
When netizens take the sacrifices of the lower class for granted, they have already planted the seeds of self-destruction.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: Here I am just expressing my views on the mutual harm among the lower classes in recent days. Of course, we all understand that how policies are turned and how they are implemented are not actually decided by ordinary people. As for the higher-level content, there are many teachers on Twitter who give very exciting talks, so I will not interrupt.

name: æè€å¸ˆä¸æ˜¯ä½ è€å¸ˆ
content: @shijianxingzou But in fact, China's lockdown policy has never been a preparation for relaxation. Nothing has been done this year. It's hard to say whether there is a difference between now and the beginning of the year.
